summary:
Full-stack developer in a wide variety of business applications. Particularly interested in client/server and relational database design using MS-SQL Server. Always interested in migration projects, optimization and user experience.

Specialties: 
C#, ASP.Net MVC & WebAPI, WCF, JavaScript, TypeScript, AngularJS, Angular, HTML, MS SQL

awards.title: IT'S24H Winner
awards.description: It was an internal 24 hours innovation competition. There were 28 teams and ours won the 1st place with an internal adaptation of crowd-funding site (like Kickstarter, IndieGoGo).

projects.title: Phonebook
projects.description:
Internal Web Application to serve all of the employees in the company.

< Development methodology >
Agile / Scrum

< Project goals >
Provide a solution for the replacement of the old Silverlight solution to ASP.Net MVC 5.
Take care about the different devices (PC, Notebook, Tablet) and screen sizes

< Functions >
  - Search (with export capability)
  - Details View
  - Hierarchy View (with moving and export capability)
  - Map View (with deep zoom technology)
  - vCard export

<  Implementation details  >
  - Microsoft ASP.Net MVC 5 based web application, written in C#.
  - Angular.js Single Page Application on client side, communicating with the server through Web API.
  - Designed with the customization of the latest Bootstrap (v3.1.1) to deliver responsive design 
  - SeaDragon deep zoom library for our map
  - Dependency Injection, IoC and Mocking framework to help our tests

contributors.headline: Research and Development Group Manager at Kontron Hungary

projects.title: GDN CAPSS - Global Delivery Network Capacity Management System
projects.description:
Global Web Application for our Global Department

< Development methodology >
Agile / Scrum

< Project goals >
Develop a web application to handle the free or partly free resources of our global department in many countries. Local manager can place a request for neccessary resource(s) and the other countries can propose candidates. Using this solution, our departments can easily share resources with each other.

< Implementation details >
Microsoft MVC 4 and SQL Server 2008 R2 based web application, written in C#.

jQuery for improve User Experience.

We are using Entity Framework as ORM, Log4Net for logging and Stateless C# State Machine library to handle business rules.

contributors.headline: Research and Development Group Manager at Kontron Hungary

projects.title: CókMók
projects.description:
"CókMók" is a charity activity for the children living in state care. Within the confines of this initiative, you can buy a very nice and compact backpack. You will pay for two backpacks, one of them will be yours and the other one will be presented to a child in the state care. With this backpack you can give him/her a strong point in his/her unsteady life. 

Details (only in hungarian): 
http://www.tedxyouthatbudapest.com/hu-HU/Video/Kovacs_Bori_Hatamon_a_vilagom.aspx

Our company and our department helped this project with creating a website, where you can get information about that program, read news and last but not least you can buy it.

Development has started as a 24 hours programming event. At the end of this event it was almost ready for use, just small parts were missing and now it has been finished.

By this time, it is in "production" and from this time forth people can help this initiative with their donation.

projects.title: EPS - Employee Performance System
projects.description:
Internal web application for our HR department.

< Development methodology >
Agile / Scrum

< Project goals >
Develop an intranet web application to handle the employees' target, review and contract modification.

Modules:
- Target Agreement: The keystone of our performance based bonus system
Every employee has to have a statement about his/her undertaken task, research or innovation.
This module handle this agreement and evaluation phase.
- Go Ahead: Employee performance review modul
- Contract Modification: Handle employees' contract change workflows

< Implementation details >
Microsoft MVC 4 and SQL Server 2008 R2 based internal web application, written in C#.

jQuery for improve User Experience.

We are using Entity Framework as ORM, Log4Net for logging and Stateless C# State Machine library to handle business rules.

projects.title: BMW - NAS, Backup Monitoring and SLA Reporting System
projects.description:
BMW is one of our biggest customer. Our company provides Network Access Storages for them and we are developing monitoring scripts about that subject in Perl.

Since Jun 2011 we are working on the SLA collecting, calculating and reporting system written in PHP.

projects.title: BMW - Automated Storage Provisioning Tool Backend
projects.description:
Automated Storage Provisioning Tool Backend development for our customer, BMW.

< Project goals >

Develop an application backend which achieve the following features:
- Create a new volume on a specific filer and set default options of it (vfiler, snapshot reserve, snapvault, etc)
- Increase volume size
- Decrease volume size
- Return a volume
- Create NFS share for a specific path with proper roles
- Update NFS share settings
- Delete NFS share

The backend has to be reachable from a web site frontend via SOAP. 

We have to handle all the possible exceptions and notify the administrators in case of any problem.

We have to have unit tests for all of the public and internal functions.


< Implementation details >

The application was written in C#, using NETAPP API. 

The endpoint was published via Microsoft WCF Service, hosted in IIS.

We used Log4Net and PostSharp 3rd party tool for automated and standardized logging of the entry and exit points of the key functions (including parameters and return value too)

Unit testing of the project was accomplished with Microsoft Unit Testing Framework.

projects.title: Cosima data consolidation
projects.description:
Cosima is the Service Center of the HP. This is the official ticketing system of our company.

The problem:
The Cosima serves our Helpdesk agents, they can open here incident and change tickets for the customers and for the company employees. Till this time the assets of the employees were maintained by hand and that made a big human resource requirement, it contained typos, duplicates, missing items because of the human factor. 

The requirement:
Connect our Asset Management tool (Atlas III) to the HP Asset Manager which is the data source of the Cosima. Implement an automated mechanism for creating and updating contact, location, cost center, asset and portfolio item information in the HP Asset Manager (based on the HP Asset Manager import logic)

Experiences gained:
    - Cooperation with German colleagues
    - Communication skills improvement
    - XML based export in a required format, with appropriate content
    - Problem management

projects.title: Cockpit enhancements
projects.description:
Cockpit is a dashboard system to report KPIs (Key Performance Indicator) for the management of the company. Based on this information they can take decisions to improve the business processes.

In this project I have implemented new features, improved the user experience with AJAX and written reusable components (UserControls) for the system.

The website is based on ASP.Net 2.0 and VB.Net, but all the new features were implemented in C#.Net capitalizing the multiple language support of the ASP.Net.

New features were:
   - Tree menu (replacing the built-in tree control with CSS friendly tree control <UL> usage instead of many <table>-s)
   - New drilldown page with AJAX for data loading
   - KPI usercontrol with tab control and with individual, sub user controls for every tab/functionality (chart, data, related wiki pages, comments, etc...)
   - New Wiki engine
   - Smaller improvements

projects.title: Target Agreement Project 2010 (Pc Sentinel)
projects.description:
My target agreement project was a PC Monitor application in C# 3.5 with MS-SQL 2008 R2.

Requirements were:
    - Monitoring system locks and unlocks
    - Monitoring running processes and applications
    - Monitoring application activity periods

Implemented:
    - All the requirements were implemented
    - Further features over the requirements:
          * Blacklist for the monitored applications
          * Log Browser in PHP with Symfony framework with Doctrine ORM

New experiences were:
    - Catch system level hooks (window activation, application starting, etc...)
    - Symfony framework 1.4 (philosophy, advantages, disadvantages)
    - Active Directory usage for authentication, authorization and employee data importing

projects.title: Production Database Migration
projects.description:
The source database was a data collector, vertical database which contained over 30 million records. Most of the collected data were never used and the performance decreased from month to month. That was the reason for this project.

During this project I had to get familiar with the structure of the source database and I had to design the new database structure which will be more efficient than the actual. 

For the performance improvement I have created as many attribute table as was necessary. In this way the search ability, maintainability and performance increased much more than earlier.

For the migration I have implemented several T-Sql stored procedures with Cursor-, Transaction- and Exception handling.

During the migration I have collected and stored exception and statistical log about the process. Based on these kinds of information I have written an alarming system which was sent email to the supporters if something went wrong and in case of exceeding the critical error number it stopped the scheduler of the migration job.

projects.title: Atlas III
projects.description:
Atlas III is an Asset Management System in PHP with MySql, Doctrine ORM and vLibTemplate.

Since the project was closed, I am supporting the system and developing enhancements and web services to serve the connected external systems.

Since the successful pilot period this system is the official Asset Management tool of our company which is used by more than 5 external applications and over 2000 employees.
